summary:
Steam is a popular online store for video games, managed by Valve. Launched in 2003, it initially provided automatic updates for Valve's games and later expanded to include third-party games. Steam offers features like matchmaking, social networking, and game streaming. It also has tools for automatic game updates, cloud storage, and messaging.

Developers can use Steamworks, a special tool, to add Steam's features to their games. Steam is available on different platforms like Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile devices. It's the biggest PC game store, with thousands of games and millions of users. Valve also makes hardware like the Steam Deck, a handheld device for playing Steam games.
title: Steam (service)
